description: VCS metrics for Azure DevOps repositories. Note: PR approval time metrics are not yet implemented in the ADO receiver. Includes metrics that align with Trunk Based Development and Small Batch Delivery.

panels.description:
Distribution of branch ages across repositories (histogram)

Query: vcs_ref_time{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"} / 86400

This histogram shows the distribution of branch ages in days. Each bar represents a bucket of branches with similar ages. The vcs_ref_time metric measures how long each branch has existed since creation from the default branch. Trunk-based development encourages short-lived branches, so most branches should cluster in lower age buckets.
panels.title: Branch Time Buckets

panels.description:
Distribution of open pull request ages (histogram)

Query: vcs_change_duration{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team", vcs_change_state="open"} / 86400

This histogram shows the distribution of how long open pull requests have been waiting. Each bar represents a bucket of PRs with similar open durations in days. PRs clustering in lower buckets indicate healthy review cycles. PRs in higher buckets may need attention or follow-up.
panels.title: Pull Request Open Time Buckets

panels.description:
Average age of all branches across the team (stat)

Query: avg by(team_name) (vcs_ref_time{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"}) / 86400

This stat shows the average branch age in days across all repositories for the selected team. The vcs_ref_time metric tracks how long branches have existed. Lower values indicate adherence to trunk-based development practices with short-lived feature branches.
panels.title: Average Branch Age (Days)
Average Branch Age (Days)

panels.description:
Average number of open branches across the team (stat)

Query: avg by(team_name) (vcs_ref_count{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"})

This stat shows the average number of branches per repository for the selected team. The vcs_ref_count metric counts all branches in each repository. Lower values suggest teams are practicing trunk-based development with fewer parallel workstreams. High values may indicate too many long-lived branches.
panels.title: Average Open Branches

panels.description:
Number of open branches per repository (bar gauge)

Query: avg by(vcs_repository_name) (vcs_ref_count{team_name=~"$team", vcs_repository_name=~"$repo"} > 1)

Displays the average count of open branches for each repository as horizontal bars. The vcs_ref_count metric is filtered to show only repositories with more than 1 branch (excluding just main). Each bar represents a repository. Longer bars indicate more parallel workstreams or feature branches, which can hinder continuous integration.
panels.title: Open Branches

panels.description:
Average duration of open pull requests in days (stat)

Query: avg by(team_name) (vcs_change_duration{team_name=~"$team", vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", vcs_change_state="open"}) / 86400

This stat shows the average time that open PRs have been waiting for review/merge. The vcs_change_duration metric measures how long each PR has been in the open state. Lower values indicate faster review cycles. High values suggest bottlenecks in the code review process.
panels.title: Average Open Pull Request Duration (Days)

panels.description:
Age of each open pull request over time (timeseries)

Query: vcs_change_duration{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team", vcs_change_state="open"} / 86400

This time series shows the age of each open pull request in days. Each line represents a specific open PR. The vcs_change_duration metric tracks how long each PR has been open. Rising lines indicate PRs aging over time. PRs that appear as horizontal lines at high values need immediate attention.
panels.title: Open Pull Request Age
Repo Count

panels.description:
Average number of branches per repository (gauge)

Query: ceil(avg by(team_name) (vcs_ref_count{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"})) > 1

This gauge shows the average branch count across all repositories. The vcs_ref_count metric counts branches per repository, and this query averages across all repos. Values > 1 are shown (excluding repos with only main branch). Lower values indicate trunk-based development practices.
panels.title: Average Branch Count

panels.description:
Average number of open pull requests per repository (gauge)

Query: ceil(avg by(team_name) (vcs_change_count{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team", vcs_change_state="open"})) > 1

This gauge shows the average count of open PRs across repositories. The vcs_change_count metric with state=open counts open PRs per repository. Lower values indicate PRs are being reviewed and merged promptly. High values may suggest review bottlenecks.
panels.title: Average  Open Pull Request Count

panels.description:
Average branch age per repository in days (gauge)

Query: avg by(vcs_repository_name) (vcs_ref_time{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"}) / 86400

This gauge shows the average branch age for each repository. Each gauge represents one repository. The vcs_ref_time metric tracks branch age in seconds, divided by 86400 to convert to days. Repositories with high average branch ages may have stale branches that need cleanup.
panels.title: Average Branch Age Per Repo In Days

panels.description:
Number of branches per repository over time (timeseries)

Query: vcs_ref_count{vcs_repository_name=~"$repo", team_name=~"$team"} - 1

This time series shows the branch count for each repository over time (minus 1 to exclude the main branch). Each line represents a repository. The vcs_ref_count metric tracks the total number of branches. Rising lines indicate branch accumulation. Trunk-based development encourages keeping this number low.
panels.title: Branch Count
Branch Age
Open Pull Request Count
Open Pull Request Age
Merged Pull Request Count
Merged Pull Request Age
Code Coverage by Repository

panels.description:
Average code coverage across all repositories (gauge)

Query: avg(vcs_code_coverage{team_name=~"$team", vcs_repository_name=~"$repo"})

This gauge shows the average code coverage percentage across all monitored repositories. The vcs_code_coverage metric is collected from Azure DevOps build reports and averaged across all repos. DORA research suggests elite performers typically have higher code coverage. Green (>80%), Yellow (60-80%), Red (<60%).
panels.title: Average Code Coverage

title: Azure DevOps - VCS & Repository Metrics
